sentences.sContent: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.sCn: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.sContent: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.sCn: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.sContent: ...There’s something about their delicate nature that appeals to me...
...the findings are in the nature geoscience...
...But the changing nature of work also plays a big role...
...The intimate nature of genuine criticism implies something about who is able to give it...
...It is human nature to seek joy in life...
...was a deeper lesson about the nature of creative criticism...
...We tend to look on nature conservation as some kind of favour that human beings are granting to the natural world...
...Yet one study after another indicates that contact with nature gives huge benefits to ADHD children...
...The error here is far too deep: not only do humans need nature for themselves...
...technology has changed the nature of the billboard business...

phrases.pCn: 生态平衡；自然平衡；自然生态平衡；自然均衡
自然保护；自然保育；自然保持

remMethod.val: nat(出生的) ＋ ure(表状态) → 本性

自然的；自然主义的；博物学的

自然的事情；白痴；本位音

对自然现象的崇拜；裸体主义
使自然化；接受…入国籍；采纳（naturalize的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather
